qas.question: What kind of weapon was used against the Mau demonstrators?
Was Chief Tamasese wounded or killed during the demonstration?
What was the phrase the Mau's chief shouted to try to calm his people?
Besides Chief Tamasese, how many Mau died as a result of the violence that erupted on that day?
What do Samoans call the historical day of the Mau demonstration?
What kind of weapon was used against the New Zeland police?
How many New Zeland police were killed during the demonstration?
What do New Zelanders call the day of the Mau demonstration?
How many women were injured in the demonstration?
What were the New Zeland police screaming to the crowd?

context: The New Zealand police attempted to arrest one of the leaders in the demonstration. When he resisted, a struggle developed between the police and the Mau. The officers began to fire randomly into the crowd and <b5_0>a <a0_0>Lewis machine gun<b5_0/><a0_0/>, mounted in preparation for this demonstration, was used to disperse the demonstrators. Chief Tamasese was shot from behind and <a1_0>killed<a1_0/> while trying to bring calm and order to the Mau demonstrators, screaming <a2_0><b9_0>"Peace, Samoa"<b9_0/><a2_0/>. <a3_0><b6_0>Ten<b6_0/><a3_0/> others died that day and <b8_0>approximately 50<b8_0/> were injured by gunshot wounds and police batons. That day would come to be known in Samoa as <a4_0><b7_0>Black Saturday<b7_0/><a4_0/>. The Mau grew, remaining steadfastly non-violent, and expanded to include a highly influential women's branch.
